15 class LedRingRosWrapperException(Exception):
16  pass
17 
18 
19 def check_ned2_version(func):
20  '''Decorator that check the robot version'''
21 
22  def wrap(*args, **kwargs):
23  robot_instance = args[0]
24  if robot_instance.hardware_version not in ['ned2', 'ned3pro']:
25  raise LedRingRosWrapperException(
26  "Error Code : {}\nMessage : Wrong robot hardware version, feature only available on Ned2 and Ned3Pro"
27  .format(CommandStatus.BAD_HARDWARE_VERSION))
28 
29  return func(*args, **kwargs)
30 
31  return wrap
32 
33 
34 class LedRingRosWrapper(object):
35 
36  def __init__(self, hardware_version='ned2', service_timeout=1):
37  self.__service_timeout = service_timeout
38  self.__hardware_version = hardware_version
39  self.__status = NiryoTopicValue('/niryo_robot_led_ring/led_ring_status', LedRingStatus)
40 
41  @property
42  def hardware_version(self):
43  return self.__hardware_version
44 
45  @property
46  def is_autonomous(self):
47  """
48  Return whether the led ring is in autonomous mode or not.
49  :return: True if the led ring is in autonomous mode, False otherwise.
50  :rtype: bool
51  """
52  return self.__status.value.led_mode == 2
53 
54  @property
55  def animation_mode(self):
56  """
57  Get the current animation mode of the Led Ring.
58  :return: The current animation mode. One of LedRingAnimation values.
59  :rtype: int
60  """
61  return self.__status.value.animation_mode.animation
62 
63  @property
64  def color(self):
65  """
66  Get the current color of the Led Ring.
67  :return: The current color of the Led Ring in RGB format.
68  :rtype: list(int, int, int)
69  """
70  return [
71  self.__status.value.animation_color.r,
72  self.__status.value.animation_color.g,
73  self.__status.value.animation_color.b
74  ]
75 
76  def __check_ned_2_version(self):
77  if self.__hardware_version not in ['ned2', 'ned3pro']:
78  raise LedRingRosWrapperException(
79  "Error Code : {}\nMessage : Wrong robot hardware version, feature only available on Ned2 and Ned3Pro"
80  .format(CommandStatus.BAD_HARDWARE_VERSION))
81 
82  # - Led Ring
83  # @check_ned2_version
84  def set_led_color(self, led_id, color):
85  """
86  Lights up an LED in one colour. RGB colour between 0 and 255.
87 
88  Example: ::
89 
90  from std_msgs.msg import ColorRGBA
91 
92  led_ring.set_led_color(5, [15, 50, 255])
93  led_ring.set_led_color(5, ColorRGBA(r=15, g=50, b=255))
94 
95  :param led_id: Id of the led: between 0 and 29
96  :type led_id: int
97  :param color: Led color in a list of size 3[R, G, B] or in an ColorRGBA object. RGB channels from 0 to 255.
98  :type color: list[float] or ColorRGBA
99  :return: status, message
100  :rtype: (int, str)
101  """
102  self.__check_ned_2_version()
103  color_rgba = color if isinstance(color, ColorRGBA) else ColorRGBA(*(color[:3] + [0]))
104  led_request = SetLedColorRequest(led_id=led_id, color=color_rgba)
105  result = self.__call_service('/niryo_robot_led_ring/set_led_color', SetLedColor, led_request)
106  return self.__classic_return_w_check(result)
107 
108  def get_led_colors(self):
109  """
110  Get the color of all the LEDs of the Led Ring.
111 
112  Example: ::
113  colors = led_ring.get_led_colors()
114  print(colors[0]) # [15, 50, 255]
115 
116  :return: List of colors for each LED. RGB channels from 0 to 255.
117  :rtype: list[list[int]]
118  """
119  self.__check_ned_2_version()
120  result = self.__call_service('/niryo_robot_led_ring/get_led_colors', GetLedColors)
121  self.__check_result_status(result)
122  return [[c.r, c.g, c.b] for c in result.led_ring_colors]
123 
124  def set_user_animation(self, animation_mode, colors, period=0, iterations=0, wait_end=False):
125  """
126  Low level function to set an animation on the Led Ring. Prefer using the high level functions.
127 
128  :param animation_mode: Animation mode to set. One of LedRingAnimation values.
129  :type animation_mode: int
130  :param colors: List of colors for the animation. RGB channels from 0 to 255.
131  :type colors: list[list[float] or ColorRGBA]
132  :param period: Execution time for a pattern in seconds. If 0, the default time will be used.
133  :type period: float
134  :param iterations: Number of consecutive animations. If 0, the animation continues endlessly.
135  :type iterations: int
136  :param wait_end: Wait for the end of the animation before exiting the function.
137  :type wait_end: bool
138  :return: status, message
139  :rtype: (int, str)
140  """
141  self.__check_ned_2_version()
142  color_rgba_list = [c if isinstance(c, ColorRGBA) else ColorRGBA(*(c[:3] + [0])) for c in colors]
143  user_led_request = LedUserRequest(animation_mode=LedRingAnimation(animation_mode),
144  wait_end=wait_end,
145  colors=color_rgba_list,
146  period=period,
147  iterations=iterations)
148  result = self.__call_service('/niryo_robot_led_ring/set_user_animation', LedUser, user_led_request)
149  return self.__classic_return_w_check(result)
150 
151  # @check_ned2_version
152  def solid(self, color, wait=False):
153  """
154  Sets the whole Led Ring to a fixed color.
155 
156  Example: ::
157 
158  from std_msgs.msg import ColorRGBA
159 
160  led_ring.solid([15, 50, 255])
161  led_ring.solid(ColorRGBA(r=15, g=50, b=255), True)
162 
163  :param color: Led color in a list of size 3[R, G, B] or in an ColorRGBA object. RGB channels from 0 to 255.
164  :type color: list[float] or ColorRGBA
165  :param wait: The service wait for the animation to finish or not to answer.
166  For this method, the action is quickly done, so waiting doesn't take a lot of time.
167  :type wait: bool
168  :return: status, message
169  :rtype: (int, str)
170  """
171  return self.set_user_animation(LedRingAnimation.SOLID, [color], wait_end=wait)
172 
173  # @check_ned2_version
174  def turn_off(self, wait=False):
175  """
176  Turns off all Leds
177 
178  Example: ::
179 
180  led_ring.turn_off()
181 
182  :param wait: The service wait for the animation to finish or not to answer.
183  For this method, the action is quickly done, so waiting doesn't take a lot of time.
184  :type wait: bool
185  :return: status, message
186  :rtype: (int, str)
187  """
188  return self.set_user_animation(LedRingAnimation.NONE, [], wait_end=wait)
189 
190  # @check_ned2_version
191  def flashing(self, color, period=0, iterations=0, wait=False):
192  """
193  Flashes a color according to a frequency. The frequency is equal to 1 / period.
194 
195  Examples: ::
196 
197  from std_msgs.msg import ColorRGBA
198 
199  led_ring.flashing([15, 50, 255])
200  led_ring.flashing([15, 50, 255], 1, 100, True)
201  led_ring.flashing([15, 50, 255], iterations=20, wait=True)
202 
203  frequency = 20 # Hz
204  total_duration = 10 # seconds
205  led_ring.flashing(ColorRGBA(r=15, g=50, b=255), 1./frequency, total_duration * frequency , True)
206 
207  :param color: Led color in a list of size 3[R, G, B] or in an ColorRGBA object. RGB channels from 0 to 255.
208  :type color: list[float] or ColorRGBA
209  :param period: Execution time for a pattern in seconds. If 0, the default time will be used.
210  :type period: float
211  :param iterations: Number of consecutive flashes. If 0, the Led Ring flashes endlessly.
212  :type iterations: int
213  :param wait: The service wait for the animation to finish all iterations or not to answer. If iterations
214  is 0, the service answers immediately.
215  :type wait: bool
216  :return: status, message
217  :rtype: (int, str)
218  """
219  return self.set_user_animation(LedRingAnimation.FLASHING, [color], period, iterations, wait)
220 
221  # @check_ned2_version
222  def alternate(self, color_list, period=0, iterations=0, wait=False):
223  """
224  Several colors are alternated one after the other.
225 
226  Examples: ::
227 
228  from std_msgs.msg import ColorRGBA
229 
230  color_list = [
231  ColorRGBA(r=15, g=50, b=255),
232  [255, 0, 0],
233  [0, 255, 0],
234  ]
235 
236  led_ring.alternate(color_list)
237  led_ring.alternate(color_list, 1, 100, True)
238  led_ring.alternate(color_list, iterations=20, wait=True)
239 
240  :param color_list: Led color list of lists of size 3[R, G, B] or ColorRGBA objects. RGB channels from 0 to 255.
241  :type color_list: list[list[float] or ColorRGBA]
242  :param period: Execution time for a pattern in seconds. If 0, the default time will be used.
243  :type period: float
244  :param iterations: Number of consecutive alternations. If 0, the Led Ring alternates endlessly.
245  :type iterations: int
246  :param wait: The service wait for the animation to finish all iterations or not to answer. If iterations
247  is 0, the service answers immediately.
248  :type wait: bool
249  :return: status, message
250  :rtype: (int, str)
251  """
252  return self.set_user_animation(LedRingAnimation.ALTERNATE, color_list, period, iterations, wait)
253 
254  # @check_ned2_version
255  def chase(self, color, period=0, iterations=0, wait=False):
256  """
257  Movie theater light style chaser animation.
258 
259  Examples: ::
260 
261  from std_msgs.msg import ColorRGBA
262 
263  led_ring.chase(ColorRGBA(r=15, g=50, b=255))
264  led_ring.chase([15, 50, 255], 1, 100, True)
265  led_ring.chase(ColorRGBA(r=15, g=50, b=255), iterations=20, wait=True)
266 
267  :param color: Led color in a list of size 3[R, G, B] or in an ColorRGBA object. RGB channels from 0 to 255.
268  :type color: list or ColorRGBA
269  :param period: Execution time for a pattern in seconds. If 0, the default time will be used.
270  :type period: float
271  :param iterations: Number of consecutive chase. If 0, the animation continues endlessly.
272  One chase just lights one Led every 3 Leds.
273  :type iterations: int
274  :param wait: The service wait for the animation to finish all iterations or not to answer. If iterations
275  is 0, the service answers immediately.
276  :type wait: bool
277  :return: status, message
278  :rtype: (int, str)
279  """
280  return self.set_user_animation(LedRingAnimation.CHASE, [color], period, iterations, wait)
281 
282  # @check_ned2_version
283  def wipe(self, color, period=0, wait=False):
284  """
285  Wipes a color across the LED Ring, light a LED at a time.
286 
287  Examples: ::
288 
289  from std_msgs.msg import ColorRGBA
290 
291  led_ring.wipe(ColorRGBA(r=15, g=50, b=255))
292  led_ring.wipe([15, 50, 255], 1, True)
293  led_ring.wipe(ColorRGBA(r=15, g=50, b=255), wait=True)
294 
295  :param color: Led color in a list of size 3[R, G, B] or in an ColorRGBA object. RGB channels from 0 to 255.
296  :type color: list[float] or ColorRGBA
297  :param period: Execution time for a pattern in seconds. If 0, the default time will be used.
298  :type period: float
299  :param wait: The service wait for the animation to finish or not to answer.
300  :type wait: bool
301  :return: status, message
302  :rtype: (int, str)
303  """
304  return self.set_user_animation(LedRingAnimation.COLOR_WIPE, [color], period, 1, wait)

308  """
309  Draws rainbow that fades across all LEDs at once.
310

316

318  :type period: float

320  :type iterations: int

322  is 0, the service answers immediately.
323  :type wait: bool
324  :return: status, message
325  :rtype: (int, str)
326  """
327  return self.set_user_animation(LedRingAnimation.RAINBOW, [], period, iterations, wait)

375  # @check_ned2_version
376  def go_up(self, color, period=0, iterations=0, wait=False):
377  """
378  LEDs turn on like a loading circle, and are then all turned off at once.
379 
380  Examples: ::
381 
382  from std_msgs.msg import ColorRGBA
383 
384  led_ring.go_up(ColorRGBA(r=15, g=50, b=255))
385  led_ring.go_up([15, 50, 255], 1, 100, True)
386  led_ring.go_up(ColorRGBA(r=15, g=50, b=255), iterations=20, wait=True)
387 
388 
389  :param color: Led color in a list of size 3[R, G, B] or in an ColorRGBA object. RGB channels from 0 to 255.
390  :type color: list[float] or ColorRGBA
391  :param period: Execution time for a pattern in seconds. If 0, the default time will be used.
392  :type period: float
393  :param iterations: Number of consecutive turns around the Led Ring. If 0, the animation
394  continues endlessly.
395  :type iterations: int
396  :param wait: The service wait for the animation to finish or not to answer. If iterations
397  is 0, the service answers immediately.
398  :type wait: bool
399  :return: status, message
400  :rtype: (int, str)
401  """
402  return self.set_user_animation(LedRingAnimation.GO_UP, [color], period, iterations, wait)

451  continues endlessly.

489  # @check_ned2_version
490  def custom(self, led_colors):
491  """
492  Sends a colour command to all LEDs of the LED ring.
493  The function expects a list of colours for the 30 LEDs of the robot.
494 
495  Example: ::
496 
497  led_list = [[i / 30. * 255 , 0, 255 - i / 30.] for i in range(30)]
498  led_ring.custom(led_list)
499 
500  :param led_colors: List of size 30 of led color in a list of size 3[R, G, B] or in an ColorRGBA object.
501  RGB channels from 0 to 255.
502  :type led_colors: list[list[float] or ColorRGBA]
503  :return: status, message
504  :rtype: (int, str)
505  """
506  return self.set_user_animation(LedRingAnimation.CUSTOM, led_colors)
507 
508  # --- Functions interface
509  def __call_service(self, service_name, service_msg_type, *args):
510  """
511  Waits for the service called service_name
512  Then calls the service with args
513 
514  :param service_name:
515  :param service_msg_type:
516  :param args: Tuple of arguments
517  :raises NiryoRosWrapperException: Timeout during waiting of services
518  :return: Response
519  """
520  # Connect to service
521  try:
522  rospy.wait_for_service(service_name, self.__service_timeout)
523  except rospy.ROSException as e:
524  raise LedRingRosWrapperException(e)
525 
526  # Call service
527  try:
528  service = rospy.ServiceProxy(service_name, service_msg_type)
529  response = service(*args)
530  return response
531  except rospy.ServiceException as e:
532  raise LedRingRosWrapperException(e)
533 
534  def __classic_return_w_check(self, result):
535  self.__check_result_status(result)
536  return result.status, result.message
537 
538  @staticmethod
539  def __check_result_status(result):
540  if result.status < 0:
541  raise LedRingRosWrapperException("Error Code : {}\nMessage : {}".format(result.status, result.message))
